WorkItem.Summary: phpExcel detects more sheets than visible

Comments.Message:
This is pretty strange. I get this for this file 24 and for the next example 26. 
You will notice that the sheets contain a " 1" in the name at the end and sometimes a " 2" for the next example.
I do exactly the same things as you do.. and for other files works perfectly. 
I did upload the other file as well so you can test it.

Yes, this is the same issue I was seeing: http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/workitem/14256
The worksheets with the appended ' 1' were causing my load() to fail because the worksheet titles breached the 31 character limit.
Just as an experiment, can you try applying gorfou's fix to PHPExcel/Shared/String.php described in http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/workitem/14233
I've tried gorfou's fix but no change. :(

Trying to debug :

PHPExcel/Reader/Excel2007.php  
371 $worksheets  - reads ok nr of sheets.
497 $xmlWorkbook->sheets - has nr. ok
1390 $excel->_workSheetCollection	- has already wrong number

any has any idea how to resolve this bug?
please help me. I am also getting this error. Only 13 sheets in my xlsx file but getting 29 sometimes 30 or 28 sheets
I have still never seen an example of a workbook that demonstrates this problem.

I'm struggling to see how simply adding cells can create additional worksheets, or how this relates to this issue at all.... and having actually tested your code without it arbitrarily adding a duplicate worksheet I'm not sure how I can replicate this problem
I reapeat yet again... provide me with a workbook that demonstrates this problem. Unless I can recreate the error I cannot fix it... and I have never seen this problem occur with any workbook

I have many workbooks that resulted in this issue. I'm attaching one now. I've only observed this problem with Excel2007 files. Excel5 files work perfectly well.

In addition, when I edit some cells in the workbook and try to save, I get a bunch of additional worksheets added (the number of additional worksheets added varies depending on each Excel file).
My file attachment is 1.xlsx, sorry.

None of the 4 worksheets attached to this work item give me any problem with extra worksheets. They all load exactly as expected. Can anybody experiencing the problem please do a phpinfo dump to see if there might be any PHP configuration issues that could be triggering this issue.

I may actually have identified a cause for this problem at long last: something that I stumbled upon in the Excel BIFF format documentation: it's a Double Stream File, a file saved as filetype "Microsoft Excel 97 & 5.0/95 Workbook", which contains 2 complete streams, one for BIFF5/7 format, the second as BIFF 8. In this case, only the BIFF8 stream should be read, not the BIFF 5/7 stream; but PHPExcel wouldn't recognise this difference. 

I now need to check if there is an equivalent in Excel2007, run some tests and see what I can come up with... I don't want to get my hopes up too much, but perhaps there is light at the end of this tunnel.

Any news on this point?
I have the same problem: more sheets in the file than expected (I'm using PHPExcel_Reader_Excel2007).
It works using  1.7.6 version, PHP 5.2.1.
It doesn't work using 1.7.6 or even 1.7.8 under PHP 5.3.2.
I tried to skip the bad sheets after reading, and re-write the modified file (using PHPExcel_Writer_Excel2007), but the bad shhets are still there! 
This is NOT a minor issue! The result is that you cannot read/write in the proper sheet!
It happens also that the bad sheets are sometimes NOT hidden, thus making huge files.
Looking forward to hearing from you.
Thanks in advance.

Still no further news because I still cannot replicate the issue with any of the files that have been posted here, or create one myself that exhibits this problem... until I have something that consistently reproduces the issue, giving me something to work with, all I can do is prod and poke and hope without ever knowing if anything I change has resolved the issue or simply risked breaking other features for nothing.

Please find enclosed 2 files:  file 'days.xlsx' has some hidden bad sheets, while file 'dips.xlsx' has many visible bad sheets.
Bad sheets name end with " 1", " 2", etc.
Thanks.

In days.xlsx, in can see sheets "01"-"31" plus "Totale" and "Riepilogo" when I look at the workbook in MS Excel 2013, and that's exactly what PHPExcel reports; when I open dips.xlsx in MS Excel 2013, I also see sheet names like "GIOMMI C. - 20 1" and "PIERGIOVANNI C. - 1 1"... which PHPExcel can also see.... should I be seeing these sheet names in MS Excel itself?

Some bad sheets are also visible in MS EXCEL as in the dips.xlsx (but this is the only example I could produce): as a matter of fact my program does not write (intentionally) those sheets (depending of read and re-write using bad indexing?).

What is interesting is the days.xlsx: in this file there are hidden bad sheets, not visible in MS EXCEL.
Please find enclosed a test file and the "bad" result (this causes wrong sheets indexing!).
Everything is ok using PHPExcel 1.7.6 and PHP 5.2.1.
But if you use PHPExcel 1.7.6, 1.7.8, 1.7.9, and PHP 5.3.2, you'll have the bad reading, as enclosed.

Thanks for your time and help.

I am facing similar issue, can you please update me on it?
